A **shocking sphere**, e, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [sphere](/wiki/Sphere "Sphere") with an affinity to [electricity](/index.php?title=Electricity\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Electricity (page does not exist)") that [emits light](/wiki/Light_source "Light source") in a 1-square radius around itself.

Shocking spheres possess a shock [explosion attack](/wiki/Explosion_attack "Explosion attack") that can destroy [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring") and [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand") in the target's inventory, and possesses [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 6b60618e](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/6b60618e0e662b35b8e9c31dc9c4baee5ae70932), shocking spheres create explosions with their attacks, which cover a 3x3 area around them and affect items and other monsters caught within the blast radius - this does not count the inventory of a hero that is [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into a shocking sphere and explodes. This is adapted from [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), and the sphere's [difficulty rating](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") is also raised to 10.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.2 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [4.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [4.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Randomly generated shocking spheres are always created hostile.

A shocking sphere [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

## Strategy

Shocking spheres are fairly annoying to deal with, since their explosion attack can destroy the hero's rings and wands, usually making them the most hazardous of the spheres. Thankfully, pets that attack shocking spheres will likely take the explosion in your stead, and fire resistance completely trivializes them. Shocking spheres can also be made to miss if you are [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible") or [displaced](/wiki/Displaced "Displaced"), and their nonexistent [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") means they can easily be put to sleep or otherwise immobilized, allowing a hero or their pet to kill them before they explode.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Shocking spheres are a tempting and often valuable target for [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide"), due to the increased danger they pose to a hero's inventory.

Per [commit 9942b65d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9942b65df78dd55a7806ec6ea2821693a7131c97), extrinsic shock resistance protects the target's open inventory from damage 99⁄100 of the time, making sources such as the [ring of shock resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_shock_resistance "Ring of shock resistance") and [blue dragon scale mail](/wiki/Blue_dragon_scale_mail "Blue dragon scale mail") much more valuable.

## History

The shocking sphere first appears in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), shocking spheres explode on death similar to [gas spores](/wiki/Gas_spore "Gas spore"), covering a 3x3 area centered on it that can affect items and monsters caught in the blast; extrinsic shock resistance can prevent both effects.

Shocking spheres may be generated in [the Lawful Quest](/wiki/Law_quest_\(dNetHack\) "Law quest (dNetHack)"), where they will appear on the Paths of Law and within the Arcadian Tower if [Oona](/wiki/Oona "Oona")'s elemental affinity is set to electricity. The [summon sphere](/index.php?title=Summon_sphere\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Summon sphere (page does not exist)") [monster spell](/wiki/DNetHack_monster_spells "DNetHack monster spells") can summon shocking spheres.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), shocking spheres can be created by [reading](/wiki/Reading "Reading") a [scroll of elementalism](/wiki/Scroll_of_elementalism "Scroll of elementalism") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused"). This also applies to [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), the explosion attack of shocking spheres covers a 3x3 radius, affecting monsters and items caught in the explosion as well as items in the affected monsters' inventories; extrinsic shock resistance protects the open inventory from damage 99⁄100 of the time.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), shocking spheres explode similarly to gas spores: both their explosion attack and on-death explosions cover a 3x3 radius centered on its square, affecting monsters and items caught in the explosion. This makes the shocking sphere a frequent [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide") target.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), eight shocking spheres are generated on the goal level of the [Acid Mage quest](/wiki/Acid_Mage_quest "Acid Mage quest"), where they are placed adjacent to the [Lightningrod](/index.php?title=Lightningrod\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Lightningrod (page does not exist)") at level creation.

## Encyclopedia entry

Shocking spheres share the entry below with other spheres:

The attack by those who want to die -- this is the attack against which you cannot prepare a perfect defense.  
                       --Human aphorism

\[ The Dosadi Experiment, by Frank Herbert ]

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Shocking sphere

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
e shocking sphere
Difficulty 8
Attacks Explode 4d6 shock
e shocking sphere
Difficulty 8
Attacks

Explode 4d6 shock

Base level 6
Base experience 91
Speed 13
Base AC 4
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 10
Nutritional value 10
Size Small
Resistances shock
Resistances conveyed None

A shocking sphere:

  • can fly.
  • does not breathe.
  • has no limbs.
  • has no head.
  • is mindless.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • gives out light.
Reference monst.c#line325

A shocking sphere, e, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is a sphere with an affinity to electricity that emits light in a 1-square radius around itself.

Shocking spheres possess a shock explosion attack that can destroy rings and wands in the target's inventory, and possesses shock resistance.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit 6b60618e, shocking spheres create explosions with their attacks, which cover a 3x3 area around them and affect items and other monsters caught within the blast radius - this does not count the inventory of a hero that is polymorphed into a shocking sphere and explodes. This is adapted from xNetHack, and the sphere's difficulty rating is also raised to 10.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 dNetHack
    • 4.2 SpliceHack
    • 4.3 xNetHack
    • 4.4 EvilHack
    • 4.5 SlashTHEM
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

Randomly generated shocking spheres are always created hostile.

A shocking sphere does not leave a corpse upon death.

Strategy

Shocking spheres are fairly annoying to deal with, since their explosion attack can destroy the hero's rings and wands, usually making them the most hazardous of the spheres. Thankfully, pets that attack shocking spheres will likely take the explosion in your stead, and fire resistance completely trivializes them. Shocking spheres can also be made to miss if you are invisible or displaced, and their nonexistent MR score means they can easily be put to sleep or otherwise immobilized, allowing a hero or their pet to kill them before they explode.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Shocking spheres are a tempting and often valuable target for genocide, due to the increased danger they pose to a hero's inventory.

Per commit 9942b65d, extrinsic shock resistance protects the target's open inventory from damage 99⁄100 of the time, making sources such as the ring of shock resistance and blue dragon scale mail much more valuable.

History

The shocking sphere first appears in NetHack 3.3.0.

Variants

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, shocking spheres explode on death similar to gas spores, covering a 3x3 area centered on it that can affect items and monsters caught in the blast; extrinsic shock resistance can prevent both effects.

Shocking spheres may be generated in the Lawful Quest, where they will appear on the Paths of Law and within the Arcadian Tower if Oona's elemental affinity is set to electricity. The summon sphere monster spell can summon shocking spheres.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, shocking spheres can be created by reading a scroll of elementalism while confused. This also applies to Hack'EM.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, the explosion attack of shocking spheres covers a 3x3 radius, affecting monsters and items caught in the explosion as well as items in the affected monsters' inventories; extrinsic shock resistance protects the open inventory from damage 99⁄100 of the time.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, shocking spheres explode similarly to gas spores: both their explosion attack and on-death explosions cover a 3x3 radius centered on its square, affecting monsters and items caught in the explosion. This makes the shocking sphere a frequent genocide target.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, eight shocking spheres are generated on the goal level of the Acid Mage quest, where they are placed adjacent to the Lightningrod at level creation.

Encyclopedia entry

Shocking spheres share the entry below with other spheres:

The attack by those who want to die -- this is the attack against which you cannot prepare a perfect defense.
                       --Human aphorism

[ The Dosadi Experiment, by Frank Herbert ]

A '''shocking sphere''', {{monsym|shocking sphere}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a [[sphere]] with an affinity to [[electricity]] that [[Light source|emits light]] in a 1-square radius around itself.

Shocking spheres possess a shock [[explosion attack]] that can destroy [[ring]]s and [[wand]]s in the target's inventory, and possesses [[shock resistance]].

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Per {{commit|6b60618e0e662b35b8e9c31dc9c4baee5ae70932}}, shocking spheres create explosions with their attacks, which cover a 3x3 area around them and affect items and other monsters caught within the blast radius - this does not count the inventory of a hero that is [[polymorph]]ed into a shocking sphere and explodes. This is adapted from [[xNetHack]], and the sphere's [[Monster difficulty|difficulty rating]] is also raised to 10.}}

==Generation==
Randomly generated shocking spheres are always created hostile.

A shocking sphere [[Corpseless|does not leave a corpse]] upon death.

==Strategy==
Shocking spheres are fairly annoying to deal with, since their explosion attack can destroy the hero's rings and wands, usually making them the most hazardous of the spheres. Thankfully, pets that attack shocking spheres will likely take the explosion in your stead, and fire resistance completely trivializes them. Shocking spheres can also be made to miss if you are [[invisible]] or [[displaced]], and their nonexistent [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]] means they can easily be put to sleep or otherwise immobilized, allowing a hero or their pet to kill them before they explode.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Shocking spheres are a tempting and often valuable target for [[genocide]], due to the increased danger they pose to a hero's inventory.

Per {{commit|9942b65df78dd55a7806ec6ea2821693a7131c97}}, extrinsic shock resistance protects the target's open inventory from damage {{frac|99|100}} of the time, making sources such as the [[ring of shock resistance]] and [[blue dragon scale mail]] much more valuable.}}

==History==
The shocking sphere first appears in [[NetHack 3.3.0]].

==Variants==
===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]], shocking spheres explode on death similar to [[gas spore]]s, covering a 3x3 area centered on it that can affect items and monsters caught in the blast; extrinsic shock resistance can prevent both effects.

Shocking spheres may be generated in [[Law quest (dNetHack)|the Lawful Quest]], where they will appear on the Paths of Law and within the Arcadian Tower if [[Oona]]'s elemental affinity is set to electricity. The [[summon sphere]] [[dNetHack monster spells|monster spell]] can summon shocking spheres.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], shocking spheres can be created by [[reading]] a [[scroll of elementalism]] while [[confused]]. This also applies to [[Hack'EM]].

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], the explosion attack of shocking spheres covers a 3x3 radius, affecting monsters and items caught in the explosion as well as items in the affected monsters' inventories; extrinsic shock resistance protects the open inventory from damage {{frac|99|100}} of the time.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], shocking spheres explode similarly to gas spores: both their explosion attack and on-death explosions cover a 3x3 radius centered on its square, affecting monsters and items caught in the explosion. This makes the shocking sphere a frequent [[genocide]] target.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], eight shocking spheres are generated on the goal level of the [[Acid Mage quest]], where they are placed adjacent to the [[Lightningrod]] at level creation.

==Encyclopedia entry==
Shocking spheres share the entry below with other spheres:

{{encyclopedia|
The attack by those who want to die -- this is the attack against which you cannot prepare a perfect defense.
                       --Human aphorism
|[ The Dosadi Experiment, by Frank Herbert ]
}}
